text: Myths and Misconceptions
translation: 神话和误解

text: Serverless is still maturing, which is why there are a lot of myths and misconceptions about how it actually works.
translation: 无服务器仍在日趋成熟，这就是为什么对它的实际运行方式有很多神话和误解的原因。

text: Myth 1: Cold starts happen on every request
translation: 误区1：每个请求都会出现冷启动

text: People often tend to overplay the role of a cold start. Cold starts don’t happen on every request. Resources are reused where possible. A cold start will only happen when no container is running with your piece of code.
translation: 人们通常倾向于夸大冷门的作用。 并非每次请求都会发生冷启动。 资源在可能的情况下被重用。 仅当没有容器与您的代码一起运行时，冷启动才会发生。

text: Myth 2: Price raising
translation: 误区二：提价

text: One of the most commonly asked questions about the costs of serverless is: But what if Amazon decides to raise the price of Lambda? This is probably a fair concern, but it’s pretty ignorant to the market forces. If the price of Lambda is raised, the customers will probably move to their competitor.
translation: 关于无服务器成本的最常见问题之一是：但是，如果亚马逊决定提高Lambda的价格呢？ 这可能是一个值得关注的问题，但对于市场力量而言却是完全无知的。 如果提高Lambda的价格，则客户可能会转向其竞争对手。

text: Besides that, historically, the data does not support that this is a thing. Amazon announced 67 price reductions in the last five years and zero price hikes.
translation: 除此之外，从历史上看，数据不支持这件事。 亚马逊宣布在过去五年中降价67，零涨价。

text: Myth 3: Serverless costs more
translation: 误解三：无服务器成本更高

text: Serverless might cost you just as much, or even more, but you get so much more done. There’s no need to invest any time and resources into maintaining servers. You don’t need to spend money on a salary for someone that has the knowledge to maintain these servers.
translation: 无服务器可能使您付出同样甚至更多的代价，但是您要做的事情更多。 无需花费任何时间和资源来维护服务器。 您无需为知道维护这些服务器的知识的人花钱。

text: The amount of ops work that developers have to do is reduced, giving them have way more time to produce code. So even if it costs more money, more time can be spent on working on customer needs.
translation: 减少了开发人员要做的操作量，使他们有更多的时间来生产代码。 因此，即使花费更多的钱，也可以将更多的时间花费在满足客户需求上。

text: Why Serverless?
translation: 为什么没有服务器？

text: There are several reasons why you should consider going serverless.
translation: 有几个原因让您考虑不使用服务器。

text: Scalable
translation: 可扩展

text: Imagine a situation where a post office could somehow magically add and decommission delivery trucks at will. Around Valentine's Day, when the mail spikes, the post office could increase the number of delivery trucks. On the other hand, the number of delivery trucks could be decreased for times when fewer deliveries are necessary. That’s essentially what serverless applications are able to do.
translation: 想象一下这样一种情况，邮局可以以某种方式神奇地随意添加和停用运输卡车。 在情人节前后，当邮件数量激增时，邮局可能会增加送货卡车的数量。 另一方面，在需要更少的交付次数的时候，可以减少运输卡车的数量。 从本质上讲，这就是无服务器应用程序能够做到的。

text: As a developer, you don’t have to think about scaling when you’re going serverless since it happens automatically.
translation: 作为开发人员，无服务器时无需考虑扩展，因为它会自动发生。

text: No need to manage servers
translation: 无需管理服务器

text: With serverless, there’s no need to worry about how to patch a server for the latest security update or other maintenance tasks that need to be done.
translation: 使用无服务器时，无需担心如何为服务器打补丁以获取最新的安全更新或其他需要完成的维护任务。

text: This leaves more time to focus on actually producing code and working on the core business. Besides that, you don’t need to hire someone who has the expertise to manage the servers.
translation: 这就留出了更多的时间来专注于实际生产代码和从事核心业务。 除此之外，您无需雇用具有管理服务器专业知识的人员。

text: This will save you time and money, which are valuable assets for every business.
translation: 这将节省您的时间和金钱，这对每个企业都是宝贵的资产。

text: Cheaper
translation: 便宜一点

text: You don’t have to pay for idle servers — you only pay when the server is actually doing something. In other words, if there’s no code running on the servers, you don’t have to pay.
translation: 您不必为闲置的服务器付费，只需在服务器实际在做某事时付费。 换句话说，如果服务器上没有代码运行，则无需付费。

text: Since most servers aren’t actively doing something for a big part of the time, going serverless can save a lot of money. In some cases, costs can be reduced by 90%.
translation: 由于大多数服务器在大部分时间里都没有积极地做某事，因此，使用无服务器可以节省很多钱。 在某些情况下，成本可以降低90％。

text: However, performance can be hurt a little bit by going serverless. Because it’s not constantly running, serverless code may need to ‘boot up’ when it’s used. This startup time may degrade performance. This is what is called a ‘cold start.’
translation: 但是，由于变得无服务器，性能可能会受到一点损害。 由于无服务器代码不是一直在运行，因此在使用无服务器代码时可能需要“启动”。 此启动时间可能会降低性能。 这就是所谓的“冷启动”。

text: If a piece of code is used regularly, though, the serverless provider will keep it ready to be activated. This is called a ‘warm start,’ which doesn’t hurt the performance.
translation: 如果定期使用一段代码，则无服务器提供程序将始终保持激活状态。 这称为“热启动”，不会影响性能。

text: Fast and more controlled deployment
translation: 快速且受控的部署

text: With serverless, there’s no need to upload code to a server in order to release a new version of the product. Developers can very quickly upload small bits of code and release a new version of the product. Code can be uploaded all at once or one function at a time. This is possible since the application is a collection of functions, instead of one big chunk of code.
translation: 使用无服务器时，无需将代码上传到服务器即可发布该产品的新版本。 开发人员可以非常快速地上传少量代码并发布该产品的新版本。 代码可以一次全部上传，也可以一次上传一个功能。 这是可能的，因为该应用程序是功能的集合，而不是一大堆代码。

text: This makes it possible to quickly update, patch, fix, or add new features to the product. Developers can update the application one function at a time, which gives them much more control over the deployment.
translation: 这样就可以快速更新，修补，修复产品或向产品添加新功能。 开发人员可以一次更新应用程序的一项功能，这使他们可以更好地控制部署。

text: Secure
translation: 安全

text: The vendor takes care of the security of the system and the network configuration around the servers that run your code. When a meltdown happens, the vendor will patch all of its servers, and you won’t even have to think about them.
translation: 供应商负责系统的安全性以及运行代码的服务器周围的网络配置。 发生崩溃时，供应商将修补其所有服务器，您甚至不必考虑它们。

text: Overall
translation: 总体

text: Overall, we could say that serverless leaves fewer ops responsibilities on the developer team’s shoulders, which means more time to work on things that actually make a difference to the customer.
translation: 总体而言，我们可以说无服务器使开发团队的工作职责减少了，这意味着有更多的时间来处理对客户产生实际影响的事情。

text: The Myths and Misconceptions About Serverless
translation: 关于无服务器的神话和误解

text: And why you should consider going serverless
translation: 以及为什么应该考虑使用无服务器

caption: Photo by Jordan Harrison on Unsplash

text: The demand for serverless computing solutions is growing. But before we go any further, let’s try to explain what this relatively new phenomenon is. The name serverless is pretty contradictory. No, serverless doesn’t mean that there’s no server involved. There has to be a server somewhere, of course. How else would we be able to do any computing?
translation: 对无服务器计算解决方案的需求正在增长。 但是，在继续进行之前，让我们尝试解释一下这种相对较新的现象是什么。 无服务器这个名字很矛盾。 不，无服务器并不意味着不涉及任何服务器。 当然，某处必须有服务器。 我们还能怎么做任何计算呢？

text: So what is serverless? This is what Wikipedia says:
translation: 那么什么是无服务器？ 维基百科是这样说的：

text: “Serverless computing is a cloud-computing execution model in which the cloud provider runs the server, and dynamically manages the allocation of machine resources.”
translation: “无服务器计算是一种云计算执行模型，其中云提供商运行服务器，并动态管理机器资源的分配。”

text: The description that I like the most comes from Gojko Adzic. He says that serverless is serverless in the way that WiFi is wireless. Because even with WiFi, there are still a lot of cables involved. Once you connect wirelessly to a network, you don’t think about all the cables that connect routers, etc.
translation: 我最喜欢的描述来自Gojko Adzic。 他说，无服务器就是无线WiFi一样的无服务器。 因为即使使用WiFi，仍然涉及很多电缆。 无线连接到网络后，您无需考虑连接路由器等的所有电缆。

text: The same thing goes for serverless. Even though there are still servers running your code, you don’t have to think about those servers.
translation: 无服务器也是如此。 即使仍有服务器在运行您的代码，您也不必考虑这些服务器。
